bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Letter from H. Carter Redd to Philip Showalter Hench, April 3, 1948

div1.p: Redd has sent Hench the Carter materials, but notes that they are not organized in any way.

div1.head: Letter from H. Carter Redd to Philip Showalter Hench, April 3, 1948
div1.opener:
Commissioner of Accounts and Commissioner in
of Circuit Court of Hanover County
H. CARTER REDD
ATTORNEY-AT-LAW
1104 TRAVELERS BUILDING
RICHMOND, VA.
April 3rd. 1948
Dr. P. S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester Minn;
My dear Doctor:-
div1.p:
I sent you on April 1st. trunk of papers in re.
Dr. H. R. Carter, and Yellow fever. There are a lot relating to
Malaria. most of which are onin the top in the trunk.

There are a lot of duplicate papers and copies of some
of the letters. You can of course keep the duplicates if you wish.

I of course did not read them and therefore there is no
“2 order”in the arrangement. All I did was to take the contents of
ther three trunks which were in a disorderly mass and pack them is
such manner as not to take up so much space.

There were a lot of photographs, frames and some books
among them the Histiry of the U. Va. which would have simply taken
up space and added weight. I had no key to the trunks, so roped
the one sent you. I hope that the material will be
of some help to you.
